docs.title: Welcome to Siphon Documentation
docs.text:
Efficiently extract, compress, and cache Git repository contexts for seamless integration with Large Language Models (LLMs).

Get Started

docs.title: Contributing to Siphon
docs.text: Welcome to Siphon! We appreciate your interest in contributing to this project. Please visit the [GitHub repository] (https://github.com/atxtechbro/siphon/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) to read the full contribution guide.

docs.title: License
docs.text: This project is licensed under the MIT License.

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• apt-workflow: correct artifact upload path to match tarball name (ced227e)
  • apt-workflow: Correct directory for rename operation (65757ff)
  • apt-workflow: correct PPA publish tarball path to match created artifact (c888f87)
  • apt-workflow: Correct quoting in tar and cp commands (f610b80)
  • apt-workflow: correct tarball creation to prevent file change error (ced987d)
  • apt-workflow: ensure correct directory name for debmake (0e77b87), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • apt-workflow: ensure correct directory renaming based on tarball version (3d3bee4), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • apt-workflow: Explicitly specify tarball path in debmake_arguments (311b2e1)
  • apt-workflow: Prevent tar from archiving its own output (4a41ad3)
  • apt-workflow: provide correct tarball name to debmake (5e059dd), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • apt-workflow: reintroduce Debian source tarball creation (29ab52d), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • apt-workflow: Reintroduce Debian source tarball creation for debmake compatibility (9033e19)
  • apt-workflow: Remove redundant Debian source tarball creation (d68e30d)
  • apt-workflow: Remove unnecessary directory renaming (8e13201)
  • apt-workflow: Simplify directory renaming (24da86f)
  • apt-workflow: Update publish-ppa-package action to use forked version (c0e1404)
  • apt: Correct file path for deb package in scp command (d1fbeb4)
  • apt: Correctly sign package for PPA upload (e248888)
  • apt: Disable host key verification for PPA upload to resolve SSH errors (a62fa7a)
  • apt: Replace scp with rsync for more robust PPA upload (f94a274)
  • apt: Use dput for PPA uploads (8f3e5b7)
  • artifacts path and spelling typo correction (76099a4)
  • choco: Include LICENSE.txt and VERIFICATION.txt in package (c3c0b70)
  • debian: Define Build Steps in debian/rules File (#15) (c1647b7)
  • debian: Install dh-python package in GitHub Actions workflow (ee9fb39)
  • debian: Refine package dependencies and update compat level (bda76c9)
  • debian: Use pybuild for Debian builds (#15) (50d06e5)
  • debug: set dput to debug mode for increased verbosity (498e390)
  • deps: dh-python and python3-all-dev added to install debian packaging tools step (8e55e9e)
  • secret name prefix typo and use as secret not variable (54f5aa4)
  • tar file changed as we read it error (227a434)
  • uses:: error correction (4115dfb)
  • workflow: Correct debmake arguments to use single hyphens for package and version (163fba5), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • workflow: Correct tarball creation to include top-level source directory (92ed724), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • workflow: Ensure artifacts dir exists before creating tarballs (7511368)
  • workflow: Ensure artifacts directory exists before creating tarballs (57eed95), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • workflow: Rename tarball top-level directory to "package-version" for debmake (2a56934), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • workflow: Replace cp with find/cpio for tarball creation to avoid "extra operand" error (d1fdcdc), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • workflow: Structure tarball with debian dir inside top-level source dir (e118bc6), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • workflow: Update APT workflow to use forked publish-ppa-package action (f7c9080), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8 yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• apt: Add tarball artifact upload for debugging upstream issue (dda0d67), closes #8 yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8 yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8 #8 yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8 yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • ci: Add build steps to choco-test.yml for package creation (b40ac56)
  • ci: Add GitHub Actions workflow for Chocolatey package testing (748f746)
  • ci: Enhance choco-test.yml with detailed logging for debugging (ba5880a)
  • Enhance Chocolatey install script for robustness (5cb11c5), closes #14
  • try using yuezk/publish-ppa-package@v2 from github actions marketplace (87d8889)
  • workflow: Generate original source tarball for debmake (2619f2e), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8
  • workflow: Specify debmake arguments to explicitly set package name and version (5f5717f), closes yuezk/publish-ppa-package#8

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• apt: fix tab indentation in debian/rules to resolve "missing separator" error (24546c2)
  • apt: generate debian/changelog to fix dpkg-buildpackage error (1f99590)
  • apt: generate debian/control to fix dpkg-buildpackage error (cfb97bd)
  • apt: generate debian/rules file to resolve fakeroot error (22a0994)
  • apt: install build-essential to satisfy dpkg-buildpackage dependencies (071c2c1)
  • apt: install python3-all to make pybuild available for packaging (86ce9b5)
  • apt: install python3-pybuild to resolve pybuild not found error (690bbe4)
  • apt: set GPG_TTY to prevent signing error in GitHub Actions (56650a0)
  • apt: switch to pybuild for packaging to resolve deprecated dh_auto_clean error (48f0a23)
  • choco: ensure siphon.exe is built before packaging (#12) (0663266)
  • ci: add checks for .nupkg file creation and specify .nuspec explicitly (62a2c1e)
  • ci: add dh_auto_configure override to debian/rules (f04c116)
  • ci: correct version formatting in APT and Chocolatey workflows (173e0a4)
  • ci: hardcode version for APT and Chocolatey package builds due to unknown version number (9a8ccb4)
  • ci: override dh_auto_clean in debian/rules to avoid python-distutils error (6f5de21)
  • ci: remove 'v' prefix from version in Debian changelog and update package filename (b26515b)
  • ci: remove python3-pybuild from apt installation to resolve package error (d62b48e)
  • ci: update debian/rules to use dh instead of pybuild (af83db9)
  • ci: update file search command to use PowerShell syntax for .nupkg files (d0eda5d)

docs.title: Features
docs.text: • add pyproject.toml for modern Python packaging (49d016f)

docs.text: • clipboard: improve emoji and Unicode compatibility across platforms (c478530)

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• address contributing.md path and SEO meta descriptions (7ec3814)
  • changelog: ensure front matter stays at the top of changelog.md (a303c10)
  • ci: add write permissions to gh-pages workflow for GitHub Pages deployment (fba9b5b)
  • clipboard: ensure UTF-8 encoding for Windows clipboard support (9847c30)
  • deploy documentation to main branch instead of gh-pages (625ecf6)
  • deploy: change deploy branch to 'gh-pages' and enable orphan commits (456d650)
  • deployment: preserve CNAME for custom domain during deployment (de228a9)
  • deployment: simplify CNAME handling by using cname field in GitHub Pages action (3f45c8f)
  • docs: hard-code MIT License in LICENSE.md and fix SEO issues (8e99990)
  • docs: update license file reference to LICENSE.md after testing locally (53b4453)
  • include image assets in deployment (1ac0e5f)
  • install missing mkdocs-meta-descriptions plugin and clean up cname comment (b534518)
  • move favicon.ico to docs directory for favicon loading experiment (2b5726c)
  • update deploy workflow to deploy documentation changes (c110fe5)
  • update paths for logo and favicon in mkdocs.yml (6380fad)
  • workflow: add pycryptodome to resolve pycrypto installation issue (3b656ab)
  • workflow: trigger deploy on all pushes to main by removing path filters (764d5e2)

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• #4: Add CI/CD Workflow for Documentation Deployment and Initial MkDocs Setup (38880b1), closes #4 #4

  • docs: initialize documentation structure for Siphon website (7648cc1), closes #4
  • images: add favicon.ico and logo.png (bb47d10)
  • trigger semantic release to update changelog (c526227)
  • update semantic-release config to move changelog to docs directory (1a5d16c)
  • workflow: add manual trigger using workflow_dispatch (5955092)

  • deploy documentation to main branch instead of gh-pages (625ecf6)
  • deploy: change deploy branch to 'gh-pages' and enable orphan commits (456d650)
  • deployment: preserve CNAME for custom domain during deployment (de228a9)
  • deployment: simplify CNAME handling by using cname field in GitHub Pages action (3f45c8f)
  • docs: hard-code MIT License in LICENSE.md and fix SEO issues (8e99990)
  • docs: update license file reference to LICENSE.md after testing locally (53b4453)
  • include image assets in deployment (1ac0e5f)
  • install missing mkdocs-meta-descriptions plugin and clean up cname comment (b534518)
  • move favicon.ico to docs directory for favicon loading experiment (2b5726c)
  • update deploy workflow to deploy documentation changes (c110fe5)
  • update paths for logo and favicon in mkdocs.yml (6380fad)
  • workflow: add pycryptodome to resolve pycrypto installation issue (3b656ab)
  • workflow: trigger deploy on all pushes to main by removing path filters (764d5e2)

  • update semantic-release config to move changelog to docs directory (1a5d16c)
  • workflow: add manual trigger using workflow_dispatch (5955092)

title: "Changelog" description: "Record of all notable changes to Siphon."

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text: Full Changelog

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• -i, --include: Include file patterns.
  • -e, --exclude: Exclude file patterns.
  • -o, --output: Output file name.

View Examples

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Siphon CLI offers powerful options for managing and extracting Git repository contents efficiently. Below are detailed examples to showcase its versatility in various scenarios.

docs.title: Example 1: Include Specific File Types
docs.text:
Extract all Python files from a Git repository and save the output in python_files.txt.

si -i "*.py" -o python_files.txt

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Ideal when you want to extract only code files for analysis.
  • Combine file types or directories to target specific file patterns.

docs.title: Additional Example:
docs.text:
Include Python and Markdown files:

si -i "*.py" "*.md" -o code_and_docs.txt

docs.title: Example 2: Exclude Directories or Files
docs.text:
Exclude specific directories or file types from the output. In this example, all files are included except those in the tests/ directory.

si -e "tests/*" -o no_tests.txt

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Skipping tests or documentation files in favor of core code.
  • Excluding large, unnecessary directories to reduce output size.

docs.title: Additional Example:
docs.text:
Exclude temporary files and logs:

si -e "*.log" "*.tmp" -o clean_output.txt

docs.title: Example 3: Interactive File Selection
docs.text:
Interactive mode allows you to choose files interactively during extraction. Siphon will prompt you for each file in the repository.

si --interactive -o selected_files.txt

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Great for when you only need to extract a few important files manually.
  • Useful when you're unsure of exact filenames and want to decide as you go.

docs.title: Example 4: Creating a Compressed Archive
docs.text:
Package your repository contents into a .tar archive. This example compresses the output into a tarball file.

si -f tar -o repo_archive.tar

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Perfect for packaging a repository to send to another developer or store for later use.
  • Compressing large codebases or datasets into a single archive for easy storage.

docs.title: Example 5: Estimating Token Counts for Large Language Models (LLMs)
docs.text:
Use the --tokenizer option to estimate token counts for specific LLMs, which is useful for determining how much text can be processed by models like GPT-3 or Claude.

si --tokenizer gpt3 -o context_with_tokens.txt

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Useful for preparing repository content to fit within token limits for LLM-based tools.
  • Estimate the number of tokens in the extracted content for accurate LLM queries.

docs.title: Additional Example:
docs.text:
Estimate tokens for Claude:

si --tokenizer claude -o claude_context.txt

docs.title: Example 6: Copy Output to Clipboard
docs.text:
Quickly copy the output to the clipboard instead of saving it to a file, which is especially useful in workflows where the output needs to be pasted directly into another tool.

si --clipboard

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Streamline workflows by directly copying extracted content to share in chats, emails, or documentation.
  • Quick access to repository contents without creating a file.

docs.title: Example 7: Print to Standard Output
docs.text:
Print the extracted content to standard output, which is useful for quickly viewing or piping the results into other command-line tools.

si --stdout

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Ideal for quick inspection or further processing with tools like grep or sed.
  • Viewing output without writing to a file.

docs.title: Additional Example:
docs.text:
Pipe the output into grep to filter for specific content:

si --stdout | grep "def"

This will extract the content and show only lines containing the def keyword (e.g., Python function definitions).

docs.title: Example 8: Combining Multiple Options
docs.text:
You can combine multiple options for more complex workflows. In this example, Siphon extracts Python files, excludes test files, and copies the output to the clipboard.

si -i "*.py" -e "tests/*" --clipboard

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Combine various filters and output options for maximum flexibility.
  • Extract only relevant parts of a large repository and make the content available in your clipboard instantly.

docs.title: Example 9: Caching and Future Features
docs.text:
Siphon’s future features will include caching for faster repeated extractions. You can enable caching now with the --cache option, though it's a placeholder for upcoming functionality.

si --cache -o cached_output.txt

docs.title: Use Cases:
docs.text:
• Speed up frequent extractions in large repositories.
  • Prepare for future updates to Siphon that will support more robust caching mechanisms.

docs.title: Getting Started with Siphon
docs.text:
After installing Siphon, navigate to your Git repository and run:

si -o context.txt

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: Siphon CLI is available for installation on Linux, macOS, and Windows using various package managers.

docs.title: 🔹 Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Linux/macOS: Python 3.6+ installed
  • Windows: Administrator access for Chocolatey

docs.title: 🐧 Debian/Ubuntu (APT PPA)
docs.text:
Recommended for system-wide installation on Debian-based systems.

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:atxtechbro/siphon-cli
sudo apt update
sudo apt install siphon-cli

✅ Auto-updates with apt upgrade

docs.title: 🖥️ Windows (Chocolatey)
docs.text:
Recommended for global CLI access on Windows.

choco install siphon

✅ Upgrades with choco upgrade siphon

docs.title: 🍎 macOS/Linux (Homebrew)
docs.text: (Planned for future versions. For now, use pip or APT.)

docs.title: 🐍 Python (pip, User-Level)
docs.text:
For Python environments or virtual environments.

pip install siphon-cli

✅ Works cross-platform but requires Python

docs.title: 📌 Verifying the Installation
docs.text:
After installation, check if siphon is available globally:

siphon --version

✅ Now you can use Siphon CLI from anywhere! 🚀

docs.title: 🛠️ Upgrading
docs.text:
• APT: sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade siphon-cli
  • Chocolatey: choco upgrade siphon
  • pip: pip install --upgrade siphon-cli

docs.title: 🔍 Need Help?
docs.text:
Check out the Docs or open an Issue.

🚀 Enjoy siphoning data across platforms! ```

docs.title: Basic Command Structure
docs.text: si [options] [path]
